name:
After every change: 
 EDIT CHANGE LOG 
 Change date of 'Current Version' 
 Export and commit flow to Github
For detailed info check Github documentation

Extract GPS
GPS Buffer \n Receives GPS from router and store it into database
Prepare data
Prepare data
Prepare Header
Handeling Measuring Data\n Receives measurement data from logger and merge data with GPS and store it into database
Handling Meta Data (Header)\n Receives the header data (containing meta information) and stores it into database
Node-Red availability test for logger
info: Befor the logger sends data to the MQTT broker of the router, it is checking via this flow, if Node-Red is listening

name: prep file and SFTP
rm local file
Parse data
Check for errors
Create netCDF Files and Transmit to Server\n A Python file creates .nc files which are transmitted to the SFTP server by a bash script.\n Files are removed after successfull transmission
Please check in regularly, if the python scripts on your deck box are up to date
packet size in bytes

Logger Config Update
 A logger can ask for a config update by sending the file name of the current config file via MQTT. 
 This flow checks, if a newer config file is available on this deck box for the given logger ID. 
 If so, the file content is prepared and send via MQTT.
Error info\n if an error message is sent by the logger during config update, it is stored in a file. \n This file can be read out or deleted manually.
list all configs
check for newer config
prep config data

Download all Config Files to Deck Box \n All config files, which are available on the server, are downloaded in regular intervals to the deck box. \n They are stored inside the 'nodeRed' docker container.
info:

TESTING YOUR DECKBOX 
 This flow simulates a logger sending measurement data via MQTT (with logger id 01 and deployment id 01.) 
 Inject "start the test" and start the netCDF flow manually.  
 Check if the netcdf file is sent to the server. 
 ATTENTION: If this test is done once on your box, you need to delete deployment 01-01  
 from python_scripts/recent_deployments.json in the nodeRed container (check docu on Github for this).
Check if test deployment is in local InfluxDB
Query
